nav.div: West Deptford School District » For Parents » Medical Information » Coronavirus Info

span.style: white-space: pre;
font-size: 20px;

font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

p.style: color: rgb(32, 31, 30); font-size: 15px; font-family: "Segoe UI", "Segoe UI Web (West European)", "Segoe UI", -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, Roboto, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif;

span.style: padding: 0px; font-size: inherit; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; border: 0px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: black;

p.span:
Dear West Deptford Families and Staff,
As you have likely heard, earlier today Governor Murphy announced that he is extending school closures until at least May 18. While we await additional guidance on the gradual lifting of social distancing requirements, our goal is to remain in constant communication with our extended school community.
Throughout the last couple of weeks, District Administration has worked to devise plans based on several scenarios, including a potential mid-May return. There are many events that unfortunately will not be able to happen this school year. With that said, the District is committed to providing students and families with as many of the treasured end-of-year experiences as possible, even if they may look a little different than what we are accustomed to. Be on the lookout for future communications from Building Principals that will address rescheduled events and impactful calendar changes. Again, after enduring this period of systemic change, our students deserve the most that we are able to provide.
In the more immediate future, students and families can look forward to a more regular schedule of “Catch-up and Collaboration Days.” The next one of these days is scheduled for Friday, April 24th. We are committed to holding one of these days periodically until our return to traditional learning.
Today’s announcement, though expected and necessary, is another difficult blow to our educational community. While our students and staff continue to achieve great things in the realm of remote learning, there is no doubt that we all wish for a return to normalcy. I remain hopeful for the rest of the school year and look forward to welcoming students back to school. Thank you for your continued cooperation, support, and patience. I wish each of you my best in staying safe and healthy. Go Eagles!
Sincerely,
Gregory J. Cappello
Superintendent of Schools
Posted 4-16-2020

span.style: font-size: 10pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;
